verses.kjv: Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and made him king in his father’s stead in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The people of the land chose Jehoahaz son of Josiah and crowned him king in Jerusalem to succeed his father.

verses.kjv: Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jehoahaz was 23 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 3 months.

verses.kjv: And the king of Egypt put him down at Jerusalem, and condemned the land in an hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
verses.ct: The king of Egypt removed him from power in Jerusalem and imposed a fine on the land of 100 talents of silver and a talent of gold.

verses.kjv: And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, and turned his name to Jehoiakim. And Necho took Jehoahaz his brother, and carried him to Egypt.
verses.ct: The king of Egypt then placed Jehoahaz's brother Eliakim on the throne over Judah and Jerusalem, changing his name to Jehoiakim. Necho took Jehoahaz away to Egypt.

verses.kjv: Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD his God.
verses.ct: Jehoiakim was 25 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. He did what was evil in the LORD his God's sight.

verses.kjv: Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
verses.ct: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon attacked him and put him in bronze chains to take him to Babylon.

verses.kjv: Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of the LORD to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon.
verses.ct: Nebuchadnezzar also took some of the items from the LORD's temple to Babylon and placed them in his own temple there.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: The rest of what Jehoiakim did, including the disgusting things he practiced and everything found against him — these are recorded in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah. His son Jehoiachin succeeded him as king.

verses.kjv: Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD.
verses.ct: Jehoiachin was 8 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 3 months and 10 days. He did what was evil in the LORD's sight.

verses.kjv: And when the year was expired, king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of the LORD, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: At the turn of the year, King Nebuchadnezzar sent for him and brought him to Babylon, along with the valuable items from the LORD's temple. Then he installed Zedekiah, Jehoiachin's relative, as king over Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD his God, and humbled not himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of the LORD.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD his God's sight and refused to humble himself when the prophet Jeremiah spoke to him with a message from the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart from turning unto the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: He also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him take an oath before God. He became stubborn and refused to turn back to the LORD God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Moreover all the chief of the priests, and the people, transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen; and polluted the house of the LORD which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On top of that, all the leading priests and the people became deeply unfaithful, following the disgusting practices of the surrounding nations. They defiled the LORD's temple, which he had set apart as holy in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the LORD God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers, rising up betimes, and sending; because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling place:
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of their ancestors, sent warnings to them through his messengers again and again, because he had compassion on his people and on his dwelling place.

verses.kjv: But they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused his prophets, until the wrath of the LORD arose against his people, till there was no remedy.
verses.ct: But they ridiculed God's messengers, rejected his words, and abused his prophets until the LORD's anger rose against his people and there was no longer any remedy.

verses.kjv: Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldees, who slew their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young man or maiden, old man, or him that stooped for age: he gave them all into his hand.
verses.ct: So he brought the king of the Babylonians against them, who killed their young men with the sword right inside their sanctuary. He showed no mercy to young men or young women, to the elderly or the feeble. God handed them all over to him.

verses.kjv: And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king, and of his princes; all these he brought to Babylon.
verses.ct: Every item from God's temple, both large and small, along with the treasures of the LORD's temple and the treasures of the king and his officials — all of it was carried off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And they burnt the house of God, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.
verses.ct: They burned down God's temple, tore down Jerusalem's walls, set fire to all its palaces, and destroyed every valuable object in the city.

verses.kjv: And them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:
verses.ct: Those who survived the sword were taken as captives to Babylon, where they served as slaves to Nebuchadnezzar and his descendants until the Persian empire rose to power.

verses.kjv: To fulfil the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed her sabbaths: for as long as she lay desolate she kept sabbath, to fulfil threescore and ten years.
verses.ct: This fulfilled the word of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah: the land finally enjoyed its sabbath rests. The entire time it lay empty, it kept its sabbath, completing 70 years.

verses.kjv: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD spoken by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
verses.ct: In the 1st year of King Cyrus of Persia, in order to fulfill the word of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah, the LORD moved the heart of King Cyrus of Persia to issue an announcement throughout his entire kingdom, both spoken and written:

verses.kjv: Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath the LORD God of heaven given me; and he hath charged me to build him an house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Who is there among you of all his people? The LORD his God be with him, and let him go up.
verses.ct: "This is what King Cyrus of Persia declares: The LORD, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, and he has appointed me to build a temple for him in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Whoever among you belongs to his people — may the LORD his God be with him, and let him go up."
